channel.title: Emmanuel Church Video Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: Weekly messages from Emmanuel Church
channel.itunes:author: Pastor Danny Anderson
channel.itunes:summary: Weekly messages from Emmanuel Church a multi-site church with locations throughout Central Indiana, featuring Senior Pastor Danny Anderson. The vision of Emmanuel is to see people come to Christ and grow in Christ so the focus of all our environments, from the weekend service, to family ministries to small groups, is to do just that. Our hope is that no matter who you are or where you’ve come from, you feel welcome at Emmanuel. Please visit us at eclife.org for more info.

item.itunes:subtitle: Hashtag - Relationship Danger

item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Dying to Live- Losing Your Life
item.itunes:summary: Our culture tells us that happiness is found in self-gratification. However, as Christians we come to learn that true life only comes by losing our lives in surrender to God and investing in other people.

item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Dying to Live - Living Dead
item.itunes:summary: Believers in Christ have become new people and therefore we must continually die to our sinful nature. We do this by making no provision for our fleshly desires and by adding scripture, solitude and fasting to our lives.

item.title: The Job
item.itunes:author: Matt Randall
item.itunes:subtitle: The Job

item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Clutter - Do It All
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Clutter - Do It All
item.itunes:summary: In the same way our closet get cluttered, so does our life. One reason our lives get cluttered is because we think we can ‘do it all’. However, through this talk we learn that we must accept the reality of limits and trade-offs to make the greatest contribution in this life.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Clutter - Disappointing People
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Clutter - Disappointing People
item.itunes:summary: Another reason our lives get cluttered is because we fear disappointing people. We say yes to almost every request. Through this talk we learn that we need to care more about what God thinks rather than what people think and that we need to prioritize our lives in order to do the good works God has planned for us.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Clutter - Creating Space

item.itunes:subtitle: Clutter - Creating Space
item.itunes:summary: Another reason our lives get cluttered is because we have not made time to clean up our messes. We must create space in our lives to refresh, reflect and refocus in order to make our greatest contribution in this life.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Clutter - Eternal Things

item.itunes:subtitle: Clutter - Eternal Things
item.itunes:summary: Another reason our lives get cluttered is because we focus on the wrong things. We must keep an eternal perspective and eliminate worldly concerns that are cluttering our souls in order to make our greatest contribution.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Baptism Weekend 2-28-16
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Baptism Weekend 2-28-16
item.itunes:summary: Baptism Weekend
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Hashtak - Parenting Social Media Savvy Kids
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Hashtak - Parenting Social Media Savvy Kids
item.itunes:summary: The world of social media for teenagers is like a digital minefield. During this sermon, Danny warns parents about the dangers of their kids using social media and what they can do to protect their children’s hearts.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Dying to Live - Losing Your Life
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Dying to Live- Losing Your Life
item.itunes:summary: Our culture tells us that happiness is found in self-gratification. However, as Christians we come to learn that true life only comes by losing our lives in surrender to God and investing in other people.

item.title: Dying to Live - Living Dead
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Dying to Live - Living Dead
item.itunes:summary: Believers in Christ have become new people and therefore we must continually die to our sinful nature. We do this by making no provision for our fleshly desires and by adding scripture, solitude and fasting to our lives.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Dying to Live - Easter Weekend
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Dying to Live - Easter Weekend
item.itunes:summary: Christ’s death on the cross was not enough to save us. His resurrection and victory over death is the reason we are able to become righteous through faith.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: The Job
item.itunes:author: Matt Randall
item.itunes:subtitle: The Job
item.itunes:summary: Jesus told us to come follow him and then carry on his ministry today. We are called to be disciple makers and can do that by spending time with God, being intentional with our relationships and serving others.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Clutter - Do It All
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Clutter - Do It All
item.itunes:summary: In the same way our closet get cluttered, so does our life. One reason our lives get cluttered is because we think we can ‘do it all’. However, through this talk we learn that we must accept the reality of limits and trade-offs to make the greatest contribution in this life.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Clutter - Disappointing People
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Clutter - Disappointing People
item.itunes:summary: Another reason our lives get cluttered is because we fear disappointing people. We say yes to almost every request. Through this talk we learn that we need to care more about what God thinks rather than what people think and that we need to prioritize our lives in order to do the good works God has planned for us.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Clutter - Creating Space
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Clutter - Creating Space
item.itunes:summary: Another reason our lives get cluttered is because we have not made time to clean up our messes. We must create space in our lives to refresh, reflect and refocus in order to make our greatest contribution in this life.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Clutter - Eternal Things
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Clutter - Eternal Things
item.itunes:summary: Another reason our lives get cluttered is because we focus on the wrong things. We must keep an eternal perspective and eliminate worldly concerns that are cluttering our souls in order to make our greatest contribution.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Celebrate - Mother’s Day
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Celebrate - Mother’s Day
item.itunes:summary: Celebration follows positive events in our lives. Life can get us down but God wants to fill us with joy. Today we celebrated the love and joy of our Mother’s.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Celebrate - Communion
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Celebrate - Communion
item.itunes:summary: Not only do we get to celebrate that Jesus freed us from the penalty of sin but he also saves us from the power of our sins. Today we celebrated Communion and remembered what he did for us on the cross.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Celebrate - Baptism
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Celebrate - Baptism
item.itunes:summary: Jesus came into the world to change our lives and that is something to celebrate. People matter to God and so therefore when even one lost person repents, we rejoice. Today we witnessed Baptisms and the lives that have been changed through Christ.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Go First - Week 1
item.itunes:author: Matt Randall
item.itunes:subtitle: Go First - Week 1
item.itunes:summary: Matt Randall, our Spiritual Growth Director, opened up a new series on leadership. Using the definition that leadership is using your influence to rally others to achieve something you can’t do alone, we learned that we are all called to be leaders because we have influence. To be a good leader, we must start with a burden, take that burden personally and above all else, make sure we act with love.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Go First - Week 2
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Go First - Week 2
item.itunes:summary: Leaders must be optimistic because it is the perspective of a leader that can affect the attitudes of an entire group of people. This optimism isn’t rooted in our own ability but in God’s ability.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Go First - Week 3
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Go First - Week 3
item.itunes:summary: Leaders must empower people. You must be secure in your identity, choose the tasks only you can do, choose the right people to empower to do the other taks, be clear on the what and the why, and trust the people to do the work you have empowered them to do.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Go First - Week 4
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Go First - Week 4
item.itunes:summary: Leaders must be prepared to handle external conflicts such as criticism, conflicts in the team, lack of motivation, disasters and opposition. The only way for leaders to stay the course in the face of these challenges is to keep themselves fired up.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Life Verse - Week 1
item.itunes:author: Bill Miller
item.itunes:subtitle: Life Verse - Week 1
item.itunes:summary: This week we introduced a new series called “Life Verse”. Claiming a Life Verse is so important because it helps to anchor your soul when you face things in this life. Bill Miller, Banta Campus Pastor, opened up the series with his life verse, Romans 8:28. It is our perspective that must change when our circumstances don’t.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Life Verse - Week 2
item.itunes:author: Greg Coble
item.itunes:subtitle: Life Verse - Week 2
item.itunes:summary: This week our Franklin Campus Pastor, Greg Coble, shared his life verse with us which was John 3:30, which talks about how God must become greater and we must become less. Words are powerful, especially God’s words and they have the power to transform our lives if we let them. We also explored four things to consider when choosing our own life verse.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Life Verse - Week 3
item.itunes:author: Jeff Johnson
item.itunes:subtitle: Life Verse - Week 3
item.itunes:summary: This week we had guest speaker, Jeff Johnson, share with us about his life verse, which is Psalm 46:10. Our identity comes from God’s identity. God is great, glorious, good and gracious so I can be still and know that he is God and that he will take care of me.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Life Verse - Week 4
item.itunes:author: Matt Randall
item.itunes:subtitle: Life Verse - Week 4
item.itunes:summary: This week, Matt Randall, our Executive Spiritual Growth Director shared with us about his life verse, which is Philippians 4:6-7. A life verse is so important because in the absence of God’s word we forget. A life verse forces us to remember the faithfulness of God.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: {im}perfect family - Week 1
item.itunes:author: Michael Kast
item.itunes:subtitle: {im}perfect family - Week 1
item.itunes:summary: This week we began a two-week mini series featuring guest speaker, Michael Kast. We talked about how it is possible to have marriages that thrive, not just survive. We discovered that this can happen by honoring, enjoying and prioritizing your spouse.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: {im}perfect family - Week 2
item.itunes:author: Michael Kast
item.itunes:subtitle: {im}perfect family - Week 2
item.itunes:summary: This week was the second week of our two-week mini series featuring guest speaker, Michael Kast. We talked about how it is possible to have a family that thrives, not just survives. We discovered that this can happen by protecting the proper family order and realizing that the goal of parenting should foremost be the successful hand off of the baton of faith to our kids.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: 45 Days: Thoughts from the Sabbatical
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: 45 Days: Thoughts from the Sabbatical
item.itunes:summary: Our Senior Pastor, Danny Anderson, returned from a 45-day sabbatical. During this talk, Danny shared with us about his time away and what it was that he felt God had showed him.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Life is Better Connected-Created for Community - Week 1
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Life is Better Connected - Created for Community - Week 1
item.itunes:summary: This week we began a new series called “Life is Better Connected”. Pastor Danny Anderson opened things up by talking about four dangers of living in isolation. We learned that casual relationships aren’t life giving and that we were created to live in community with others.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Life is Better Connected - The Application is What Matters - Week 2
item.itunes:summary: During this week, Danny talked about the fact that we all have a tendency to hear and not to do. However, it’s not the listening that matters, it’s the doing that makes the difference. And when you choose to live in community, you increase the likelihood of becoming a doer on your spiritual journey.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Life is Better Connected - The Power of Prevention - Week 3
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Life is Better Connected - The Power of Prevention - Week 3
item.itunes:summary: In the third and final weekend of the Life is Better Connected series, Danny talked about the power of group life being preventative. You need to do group when you don’t need it, so you can have the support when you need it.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: I Love My Job
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: I Love My Job
item.itunes:summary: In this stand-alone sermon, Pastor Danny talked about how you can find ways to love your job even when you don’t. He focused on having a great morning routine and how all work that is done well and helps people has dignity. He closed the talk by having us realize the bigger picture of our job as a means to our discipleship with Jesus.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Unsearchable- Christ Brings Knowledge of Reality
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Unsearchable- Christ Brings Knowledge of Reality
item.itunes:summary: Danny opened up a four-week series called Unsearchable. This week he talked about how Christ brings knowledge of reality. As Christians, we fix our eyes on what is unseen because what is seen is temporary. The unseen kingdom of God brings power, peace, joy and love. These are riches we should share with others.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Unsearchable - The Good Life
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Unsearchable - The Good Life
item.itunes:summary: For the second week of our Unsearchable series, Danny talked about how people are looking for the good life. We found out that those who have the good life are the ones living in the Kingdom of God. No human condition excludes blessedness.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Unsearchable - Who is God
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Unsearchable - Who is God
item.itunes:summary: For the third week of our Unsearchable series, Danny talked about how a ‘good person’ can only be defined as a disciple of Jesus. And since love is the mark of a disciple, a ‘good person’ always acts for the good of others.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Unsearchable - Grace
item.itunes:summary: For the fourth and final week of our Unsearchable series, Danny talked about how to access God’s grace. Grace is more than just the unmerited favor of God but it is also strength for our lives. You have to believe that God’s way of living is possible and better and you have to begin training to create space for God to work through you.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Fight
item.itunes:author: Matt Randall
item.itunes:subtitle: Fight
item.itunes:summary: Matt Randall, our Executive Director of Spiritual Growth, shared a message about the need to fight for a great marriage. Marriages are under attack from the enemy but a great marriage is possible if you put God first, invest your time/focus and fight well during conflict in marriage.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Hindrance- Perspective
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Hindrance- Perspective
item.itunes:summary: Senior Pastor, Danny Anderson, began a four-week series called ‘Hindrance’. During week one of the series, he talked about how God is always working and his desire is for us to partner with him in that work. Sometimes, we hinder God’s work through an incorrect perspective and when things get difficult our perspective should be that God is at work in me.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Hindrance- Faith
item.itunes:summary: During week two of the Hindrance series, Danny talked about how we can hinder the work of God when we lack faith. In order to increase our faith, we must focus on who God is, saturate our minds with God’s word and exercise our faith regularly.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Hindrance- Hypocrisy
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Hindrance- Hypocrisy
item.itunes:summary: During week two of the Hindrance series, Danny talked about how we can hinder the work of God when we lack faith. In order to increase our faith, we must focus on who God is, saturate our minds with God’s word and exercise our faith regularly.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: The VOTE 2016
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: The VOTE 2016
item.itunes:summary: Danny took a break in our Hindrance series in order to address the upcoming election. He focused on the fact that we should vote and vote like Jesus would. He also talked about not losing your influence when it comes to the politics as there is a bigger story at hand.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Hindrance- Pride
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Hindrance- Pride
item.itunes:summary: During the final week of the Hindrance series, Danny talked about how sin can hinder the work of God and that pride is the root of all sin. In order to get rid of pride in our lives we must admit we are proud and see everything in our life as a gift from God.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Generosity - Truly Life
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Generosity - Truly Life
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Danny began a 3-week series today called “Generosity”. During this first week, he shares about three attributes you have when you live a generous life. You live from your true identity, you reflect the heart of God, and you step into real life. We learn that the more you give, the more you live.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Generosity - Get Rid of It
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Generosity - Get Rid of It
item.itunes:summary: During the second week of the Generosity series, Pastor Danny talks about three things we must rid ourselves of in order to live a generous life. We must rid ourselves of greed, debt, and self-reliance. The Christian life is a life of dependence upon God, even in our finances.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Generosity - Give Joyfully
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Generosity - Give Joyfully
item.itunes:summary: During the third week of the Generosity series, Pastor Danny talks about the importance of being a cheerful giver. You have to see yourself as God’s money manager, see yourself as the beneficiary, and see yourself as living forever when it comes to giving back to God what he gave you.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Christmas at Emmanuel- Personal Satisfaction
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Christmas at Emmanuel- Personal Satisfaction
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Danny begins a new series called Christmas at Emmanuel. During the first week of the series, he talks about the good news that Christmas brings. We can prevent ourselves from being distracted from the true meaning of Christmas by releasing expectations and spending time with God.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Christmas at Emmanuel- Relationships
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Christmas at Emmanuel- Relationships
item.itunes:summary: During the second week of this series, Danny talks about how relationships are difficult, especially during the holidays. We learn that Christmas gatherings can be easier if we are kind, gracious, quiet and prepared.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Christmas at Emmanuel- Fellowship with God
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Christmas at Emmanuel- Fellowship with God
item.itunes:summary: During the final week of this series, Danny talks about how God's presence brings eternal life now and helps us to never feel alone. This was a special Christmas Eve message.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: The Power of Reflection
item.itunes:author: Greg Coble
item.itunes:subtitle: The Power of Reflection
item.itunes:summary: Franklin Campus Pastor, Greg Coble, does a stand-alone message called "The Power of Reflection". During his message, he encourages us to look back in order to be successful moving forward because looking back gives you wisdom and courage to face the future.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Closer Than Ever
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Closer Than Ever
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Danny began a new series this week called Closer Than Ever. During this first week, we explore the beginning of Psalm 34 to be encouraged on how to have a closer relationship with God than we ever have before. We can do that by making God our treasure, taking pride in God, and making God look great. In parallel to Danny's message, the church as a whole is taking on a 21-day fasting challenge to help us refocus on God at the beginning of the year. For more information about this fast or about Emmanuel Church in general, please visit our website, eclife.org or our Facebook page.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Closer Than Ever Week 2
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Closer Than Ever Week 2
item.itunes:summary: During this second week of the Closer Than Ever series, Pastor Danny talks about the importance of seeking God. When we seek Him we experience deliverance and satisfaction. In parallel to Danny’s messages, the church as a whole is taking on a 21-day fasting challenge to help us refocus on God at the beginning of the year. For more information about this fast or about Emmanuel Church in general, please visit our website, eclife.org or our Facebook page.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Closer Than Ever Week 3
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Closer Than Ever Week 3
item.itunes:summary: During the third week of the Closer Than Ever series, Pastor Danny talks about the fear of the Lord. To fear God ultimately means to be concerned with what God thinks. We cultivate the fear of the Lord when we begin to understand who He is.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Closer Than Ever Week 4
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Closer Than Ever Week 4
item.itunes:summary: In the final message of the Closer Than Ever series, Pastor Danny talks about allowing pain to humble us. God wants to partner with humble people. Will you all the pain in your life to harden you or humble you?
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Love is a Verb, Action Word: Love
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Love is a Verb, Action Word: Love
item.itunes:summary: Danny began a new series this week called 'Love is a Verb'. So often we think of love as an emotion or feeling but in this series we will uncover that love is actually a call to action. In week one, Danny talks about how much of human behavior is compensation for the lack of security, support, acceptance and appreciation we have had in our lives. But when we love others the right way, we help close the deficit.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Love is a Verb, Action Word: Connect
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Love is a Verb, Action Word: Connect
item.itunes:summary: During the second week of our series, ‘Love is a Verb’, Pastor Danny talks about how loving people well in relationships takes energy and that is something that most of us feel we lack. However, we learn that there is power available in God to love well. You must connect with God and to connect, you must plug-in.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Love is a Verb, Action Word: Forgive
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Love is a Verb, Action Word: Forgive
item.itunes:summary: For the third week of our ‘Love is a Verb’ series, guest speaker Michael Kast, from Southeast Christian Church, talks about the difficulty of forgiveness. Michael addresses why should we forgive, when we should forgive, and how we can take steps towards forgiveness today.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: Love is a Verb, Action Word: Serve
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Love is a Verb, Action Word: Serve
item.itunes:summary: Danny closes out the final week of our ‘Love is a Verb’ series. He talks about how our need to be great can negatively affect our relationships. We learn, however, that the true path to greatness is to serve others. Jesus is our example of this.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: (un)offended, Let God be God
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: (un)offended, Let God be God
item.itunes:summary: Danny introduces a brand-new series this week called, (un)offended. We live in a society today where everyone always seems to be offended about something. But as Christ followers, we don’t have to be. In week one of the series, Danny talks about how getting offended can lead to exhaustion, foolishness, broken relationships and distraction in our lives. To avoid getting offended we have to let God be God.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: (un)offended, Guilty
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: (un)offended, Guilty
item.itunes:summary: In this second week of the (un)offended series, Pastor Danny talks about our tendency to see ourselves better than other people. However, we are just as guilty as everyone else and that is why we needed Jesus to die on a cross. We have to get honest with ourselves because ALL have sinned and fallen short of God’s glory.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: (un)offended, The Other Side
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: (un)offended, The Other Side
item.itunes:summary: In the third week of the (un)offended series, Pastor Danny helps us understand that there is always another side to the story and this is something we should consider to become unoffended. We can better understand the other side by not rushing to judgment, seeking first to understand, and getting insight about certain situations from other people before jumping to conclusions.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: (un)offended, Referee
item.itunes:author: Matt Randall
item.itunes:subtitle: (un)offended, Referee
item.itunes:summary: Executive Director of Spiritual Growth, Matt Randall, closes out the (un)offended series by talking about how Christians have deemed themselves the referees of the world. However, God’s desire is for us to ‘put down the whistle’ and choose influence over being offended.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: 40 Years and Counting, A Look Back
item.itunes:author: Danny Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: 40 years and counting, A Look Back
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Danny Anderson begins a new series where he reflects back on the past 40 years of ministry at Emmanuel Church. We learn that there is great value in looking back. We’ve seen God move over the last 40 years and we all get to play a role in the story God is telling, a story that actually started over 2,000 years ago.
item.itunes:keywords: faith, christian, christianity, emmanuel, christ, heart, god, practical

item.title: 40 Years and Counting, What Do You Really Believe?

item.itunes:subtitle: My Big Fat Mouth: Criticizing
item.itunes:summary: Our words create the quality of our life and the lives of those around us. We can either build someone up with our words or tear them down. Criticizing words come naturally, yet they bring pain and hurt to those around us. Why is it so hard to avoid criticizing others? item.itunes:subtitle: My Big Fat Mouth: Gossip
